satya_yuga.name: Satya Yuga
satya_yuga.symbolic_origin: Golden Age, Dharma stands on all four legs
satya_yuga.role: Era of righteousness, spiritual wisdom, and harmony
satya_yuga.time_reference: First of the four Yugas, lasting 1,728,000 years
satya_yuga.label: Satya Yuga (Golden Age)

treta_yuga.name: Treta Yuga
treta_yuga.symbolic_origin: Silver Age, Dharma stands on three legs
treta_yuga.role: Era of great kings and the Ramayana, decline in virtue
treta_yuga.label: Treta Yuga (Silver Age)

dwapara_yuga.name: Dwapara Yuga
dwapara_yuga.symbolic_origin: Bronze Age, Dharma stands on two legs
dwapara_yuga.role: Era of Mahabharata and Lord Krishna, further decline in virtue
dwapara_yuga.label: Dwapara Yuga (Bronze Age)

kali_yuga.name: Kali Yuga
kali_yuga.symbolic_origin: Iron Age, Dharma stands on one leg
kali_yuga.role: Current era, marked by spiritual decline and materialism
kali_yuga.label: Kali Yuga (Iron Age)

vedic_period_(developed_fully_in_early_c.name: Shiva
vedic_period_(developed_fully_in_early_c.nature: Supreme deity in Shaivism, both destroyer and transformer within the Hindu Trimurti
vedic_period_(developed_fully_in_early_c.symbolic_origin: Represents cosmic destruction and regeneration, beyond time and space
vedic_period_(developed_fully_in_early_c.role: Embodiment of asceticism, meditation, and divine energy; worshiped as Mahadeva
vedic_period_(developed_fully_in_early_c.time_reference: Prominent in Puranic era and integrated into Hindu philosophy
vedic_period_(developed_fully_in_early_c.label: Shiva (Hindu deity, Vedic roots)

unknown.name: Lord Vishnu
unknown.symbolic_origin: Cosmic ocean (Ksheer Sagara), resting on Ananta Shesha
unknown.role: Preserver, sustainer, manifests in avatars to restore dharma
unknown.time_reference: Appears in every Yuga through incarnations
unknown.label: Lord Vishnu (Timeless)

vedic_period_(circa_1500–500_bce),_promi.name: Vishnu
vedic_period_(circa_1500–500_bce),_promi.nature: Preserver and protector of the universe, supreme deity in Vaishnavism
vedic_period_(circa_1500–500_bce),_promi.symbolic_origin: Embodies cosmic order, sustenance, and dharma
vedic_period_(circa_1500–500_bce),_promi.role: Maintains balance of creation, incarnates as avatars (e.g., Rama, Krishna) to restore dharma
vedic_period_(circa_1500–500_bce),_promi.time_reference: Vedic roots, fully developed in Puranic texts
vedic_period_(circa_1500–500_bce),_promi.label: Vishnu (Hindu deity, Vedic roots)

vedic_period_(circa_1500–500_bce).name: Brahman
vedic_period_(circa_1500–500_bce).nature: Infinite, formless, eternal, and ultimate reality in Hindu philosophy
vedic_period_(circa_1500–500_bce).symbolic_origin: Uncreated, beyond time, space, and attributes
vedic_period_(circa_1500–500_bce).role: Supreme cosmic principle, source of all existence, described in the Upanishads
vedic_period_(circa_1500–500_bce).label: Brahman (Hindu concept, Vedic period)

matsya.name: Matsya
matsya.role: Saved the Vedas and humanity from deluge
matsya.label: Matsya (Fish Avatar)

kurma.name: Kurma
kurma.role: Supported Mount Mandara during churning of the ocean
kurma.label: Kurma (Tortoise Avatar)

narasimha.name: Narasimha
narasimha.role: Destroyed demon Hiranyakashipu to protect devotee Prahlada
narasimha.label: Narasimha (Man-Lion Avatar)

vamana.name: Vamana
vamana.symbolic_origin: Symbol of humility and cosmic balance
vamana.role: Subdued demon king Bali by covering universe in three steps
vamana.time_reference: Transition from Satya to Treta Yuga (symbolic)
vamana.label: Vamana (Dwarf Avatar)

parashurama.name: Parashurama
parashurama.role: Destroyed corrupt Kshatriyas to restore balance
parashurama.label: Parashurama (Warrior Avatar)

krishna.name: Krishna
krishna.symbolic_origin: Symbol of love, wisdom, and cosmic play
krishna.role: Guided Arjuna in Bhagavad Gita, destroyed evil forces
krishna.label: Krishna (Divine Avatar)

buddha.name: Buddha
buddha.role: Taught path of peace and renunciation era
buddha.label: Buddha (Teacher Avatar)

kalki.name: Kalki
kalki.role: Will appear at end of Kali Yuga to destroy evil
kalki.time_reference: Predicted ~427,000 years from now (end of Kali Yuga)
kalki.label: Kalki (Future Avatar)

lord_rama.name: Lord Rama
lord_rama.symbolic_origin: Born in Ayodhya to King Dasharatha and Queen Kausalya
lord_rama.role: Embodiment of dharma, ideal king, hero of Ramayana
lord_rama.label: Lord Rama (Treta Yuga)

lord_krishna.name: Lord Krishna
lord_krishna.symbolic_origin: Born in Mathura to Vasudeva and Devaki
lord_krishna.role: Teacher of Bhagavad Gita, divine strategist, embodiment of love
lord_krishna.label: Lord Krishna (Dwapara Yuga)

vyasa.name: Vyasa
vyasa.nature: Compiler of Vedas and author of Mahabharata
vyasa.symbolic_origin: Embodies wisdom, knowledge, and preservation of dharma
vyasa.role: Composed Mahabharata, compiled Vedas, authored Puranas
vyasa.label: Vyasa (Hindu sage, Vedic roots)

valmiki.name: Valmiki
valmiki.role: Composed Ramayana, revered as Adi Kavi (first poet)
valmiki.label: Valmiki (Hindu sage, Vedic roots)

agastya.name: Agastya
agastya.nature: Sage known for wisdom and spreading Vedic knowledge to South India
agastya.symbolic_origin: Symbol of balance and cultural integration
agastya.role: Composed hymns in Rigveda, introduced Vedic culture to southern regions
agastya.label: Agastya (Hindu sage, Vedic roots)

narada.name: Narada
narada.role: Acts as celestial messenger, spreads knowledge and devotion
narada.time_reference: Appears in Vedas, Mahabharata, Ramayana, and Puranas
narada.label: Narada (Hindu sage, Vedic roots)

durga.name: Durga
durga.symbolic_origin: Represents divine feminine power and protection
durga.role: Defeated demon Mahishasura, protector of dharma
durga.label: Durga (Hindu goddess, Puranic roots)

lakshmi.name: Lakshmi
lakshmi.nature: Goddess of wealth, prosperity, and fortune
lakshmi.role: Consort of Vishnu, bestows wealth and well-being
lakshmi.label: Lakshmi (Hindu goddess, Puranic roots)

saraswati.name: Saraswati
saraswati.nature: Goddess of wisdom, learning, and arts
saraswati.role: Associated with Vedas, music, and education
saraswati.time_reference: Prominent in Puranas and Vedic hymns
saraswati.label: Saraswati (Hindu goddess, Vedic roots)

subramanya_(kartikeya,_murugan).name: Subramanya (Kartikeya, Murugan)
subramanya_(kartikeya,_murugan).nature: God of war and victory, son of Shiva and Parvati
subramanya_(kartikeya,_murugan).symbolic_origin: Embodies courage, wisdom, and divine leadership
subramanya_(kartikeya,_murugan).role: Commander of the celestial army, protector of dharma, revered especially in South India
subramanya_(kartikeya,_murugan).time_reference: Prominent in Skanda Purana and Tamil Sangam literature
subramanya_(kartikeya,_murugan).label: Subramanya Swami (Hindu deity, Puranic roots)

ganesha.name: Ganesha
ganesha.nature: Remover of obstacles, god of beginnings
ganesha.role: Invoked before any new venture, son of Shiva and Parvati
ganesha.time_reference: Prominent in Puranas and devotional traditions
ganesha.label: Ganesha (Hindu deity, Puranic roots)

early_civilization.name: Early Civilization
early_civilization.role: Foundation of human society, start of organized communities
early_civilization.label: EBC (Estimated Beginning of Civilization)

vedic_period.name: Vedic Period
vedic_period.nature: Development of spiritual and philosophical texts
vedic_period.role: Rise of early Indian civilization, formation of rituals and social order
vedic_period.label: Vedic Period

buddha_&_mahavira.name: Buddha & Mahavira
buddha_&_mahavira.nature: Spiritual leaders and founders of Buddhism and Jainism
buddha_&_mahavira.role: Spread of non-violence, meditation, and renunciation
buddha_&_mahavira.label: Buddha & Mahavira

gupta_empire.name: Gupta Empire
gupta_empire.role: Advances in science, mathematics, arts, and literature
gupta_empire.label: Gupta Empire

delhi_sultanate.name: Delhi Sultanate
delhi_sultanate.symbolic_origin: Establishment after the Battle of Tarain
delhi_sultanate.role: Cultural and architectural transformation, introduction of new governance
delhi_sultanate.label: Delhi Sultanate

mughal_empire.name: Mughal Empire
mughal_empire.role: Unification of large parts of India, flourishing of art and architecture
mughal_empire.label: Mughal Empire

british_rule_begins.name: British Rule Begins
british_rule_begins.nature: Colonial rule by the British Empire
british_rule_begins.role: Economic and social transformation, resistance and reform movements
british_rule_begins.label: British Rule Begins

indian_independence.name: Indian Independence
indian_independence.nature: End of colonial rule, birth of a nation
indian_independence.role: Formation of a sovereign democratic republic
indian_independence.label: Indian Independence

republic_of_india.name: Republic of India
republic_of_india.nature: Adoption of the Constitution of India
republic_of_india.role: Establishment of democratic governance and fundamental rights
republic_of_india.label: Republic of India

present_day.name: Present Day
present_day.nature: Modern India: technology, economy, and culture
present_day.role: Global presence, innovation, and cultural continuity
present_day.label: Present Day
